title: WHIRLING F1 ORB / dialogue karaoke inspiration

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "You should totally sing karaoke her..."
dialogueTree.text: You should totally sing karaoke here, the first chance you get. Your emotions need to be expressed. People need to know of your vast, oceanic soul.

links.title: You: "My soul is immense."
links.text: My soul is immense.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Utterly. And it needs to be heard."
links.text: Utterly. And it needs to be heard.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Through a PA system."
links.text: Through a PA system.

links.title: Inland Empire: "By other people."
links.text: By other people.

links.title: Half Light: "Whether they like it or not. Ram it..."
links.text: Whether they like it or not. Ram it up their ears, says your adrenaline gland. Violently express yourself.

links.title: You: "This goes well with a theory I'm de..."
links.text: This goes well with a theory I'm developing: that I'm a down-on-my-luck superstar person.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Who is mistakenly identified as a c..."
links.text: Who is mistakenly identified as a cop for his prominent jaw line? Yes, sounds likely. You should probably go on stage and pose for a moment when you're done with this thought. See if it works.

links.title: Inland Empire: "There has been precisely no evidenc..."
links.text: There has been precisely no evidence to the contrary. So yes, Yes, it's likely. You should probably go on stage and pose for a moment when you're done with this thought. See if it works.

links.title: You: "What should I sing, when it comes t..."
links.text: What should I sing, when it comes to it?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You should sing the sad, small chur..."
links.text: You should sing the sad, small church song, duh. Thought it was obvious...

links.title: You: "Of course! They'll really get a gau..."
links.text: Of course! They'll really get a gauge on my soul with that one.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Serves them right! Wipe that smirk..."
links.text: Serves them right! Wipe that smirk off their face with your sad, tragic small church song. Who's laughing now? No one.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Serves them right! Wipe that smirk..."
links.text: Serves them right! Wipe that smirk off their face with your sad, tragic song. Who's laughing now? No one.

links.title: You: "I was thinking maybe I could sing s..."
links.text: I was thinking maybe I could sing something happy. Like, from those Ostentatious Orchestrations folks...

links.title: Inland Empire: "No-no, don't sing the happy song, i..."
links.text: No-no, don't sing the happy song, it's stupid. Sing the sad song, it's profound.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You have to find out how the song g..."
links.text: You have to find out how the song goes first, though... maybe a tape of something appropriate would help.

links.title: You: "I was thinking maybe I could sing s..."
links.text: I was thinking maybe I could sing something happy. Get the crowd going.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You should sing the sad small churc..."
links.text: You should sing the sad small church song from that tape you found. Thought it was obvious...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You should sing the sad, slow song..."
links.text: You should sing the sad, slow song you were listening to last night. Thought it was obvious...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You should sing that sad song you w..."
links.text: You should sing that sad song you were listening to last night. Thought it was obvious...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You have not yet stumbled on the ri..."
links.text: You have not yet stumbled on the right *lamentation*. But it's out there. It'll come to you. You'll wreak havoc with it, don't worry.

links.title: You: "Lamentation sounds good. They'll re..."
links.text: Lamentation sounds good. They'll really get a gauge on my soul with that.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Serves them right! Wipe that smirk..."
links.text: Serves them right! Wipe that smirk off their face with your sad, tragic song. Who's laughing now? No one.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You have to find something tragic t..."
links.text: You have to find something tragic to sing first, though.

links.title: You: "I was thinking maybe I could sing s..."
links.text: I was thinking maybe I could sing something happy. Get the people going.

links.title: Inland Empire: "No-no, don't sing the happy song, i..."
links.text: No-no, don't sing the happy song, it's stupid. Sing the sad song, it's profound.

links.title: You: "[Finish thought.]"
links.text: [Finish thought.]

links.title: You: "My soul is modest. It's normal size..."
links.text: My soul is modest. It's normal sized.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Exactly. It's measured, level-heade..."
links.text: Exactly. It's measured, level-headed, and it needs to be heard.

links.title: You: "My soul is puny."
links.text: My soul is puny.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Of course. Like a small animal that..."
links.text: Of course. Like a small animal that only comes out at night. All it needs -- is to be heard.

links.title: You: "My soul's cubic content is obscured..."
links.text: My soul's cubic content is obscured by the hangover.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Of course. At this point, precise m..."
links.text: Of course. At this point, precise measurements of your soul can only be performed from the outside. It needs to be heard.

links.title: You: "[Discard thought.]"
links.text: [Discard thought.]
